Posts.Content: hi jenny well i think you have every right to feel down. being positive is all very well for others to say but im a firm believer in going with how you feel. have a good cry, scream, shout and try to get it out.(i did this the other day) might make you feel better. too much emphasis is put on us cancer patients to paint a smile on, be strong and pretend we are ok. what you are going through is not normal and others shouldnt suddenly expect us to be superhuman. my thoughts are with you and am sending you big hugs  wendy x
Posts.Title: Feeling down

Posts.Content: hi kerry i too am having fec-t. i tried the cold cap on first cycle even though i was told it wouldnt work. by day 14 after chemo my long hair was coming out in handfuls and had more bald than hair. had clippers at the ready and shaved it all off. i dont regret trying cold cap as i know i would have been annoyed with myself if i didnt. go in with an open mind but have a back up plan just in case. i had a wig fitting prior to chemo so could wear a wig if i wanted but im actually quite liking the bald look and generally dont wear anything. good luck whatever happens  wendy x
Posts.Title: Feedback on cold cap please?

Posts.Content: hi kerry i too am having fec-t. i tried the cold cap on first cycle even though i was told it wouldnt work. by day 14 after chemo my long hair was coming out in handfuls and had more bald than hair. had clippers at the ready and shaved it all off. i dont regret trying cold cap as i know i would have been annoyed with myself if i didnt. go in with an open mind but have a back up plan just in case. i had a wig fitting prior to chemo so could wear a wig if i wanted but im actually quite liking the bald look and generally dont wear anything. good luck whatever happens  wendy x
Posts.Title: Feedback on cold cap please?

Posts.Content: hi  starting fec-t next week and was hoping to try the cold cap. however onc has told me it doesnt work with fec-t as drugs are too strong too strong. has anyone else used cold cap with this regime  and been sucessful? x
Posts.Title: fec-t and cold cap

Posts.Content: thanks ladies i think im going to give it a try. my onc was so anti cold cap and wouldnt even consider it working. i know its time consuming and uses valuable nursing resources but feel quite annoyed she dismissed it so completely. got my chemo assessment on wed so will insist that i would like to try it. x
Posts.Title: fec-t and cold cap

Posts.Content: well i had my inital diagnosis and saw the surgeon briefly. he said that i had plenty of time to decide on my choice of procedure. i pressumed finalisation would happen at the pre op. i havent heard from anyone regarding treatment etc. tried to speak to bc nurse and left countless messages for her to ring me this week, still nothing. am disgusted with the lack of care ive received. am now very worried and will be making a complaint tom. just dont need this. thought there was supposed to be support in place.
Posts.Title: NO DISCUSSION

Posts.Content: thanks for everyone's replies. well eventually got hold of bcn and went to see her on fri. apologised profusely for not contacting me and said she never received any messages. went through everything thoroughly. appointment was for an hour but i stayed 2! i managed to have a quick word with the surgeon who put my mind at rest and we now have a plan. it appears all paperwork sent to me regarding times for op, length of stay and several other things were all wrong so just as well i got it sorted. feeling much better now although i have made an offical complaint. wish me luck monday  x
Posts.Title: NO DISCUSSION

Posts.Content: hi  i had my pre-op assessment yesterday and was given the impression i would be able to discuss which surgery i would prefer as hadnt decided if i wanted theraputic mammoplasty of full mastectomy. also lump has got bigger and presumed they would have checked this at pre op.they only checked bloods, ecg and normal health questions. cant get hold of bcn either. really panicking now as dont just want to be wheeled in for surgery without any discussion. my surgery is booked for mon 6th july.
Posts.Title: NO DISCUSSION

Posts.Content: cant imagine how  much pain you must be feeling but will be thinking of you xxx
Posts.Title: My poor son's inquest tomorrow

Posts.Content: well back to square one. property i thought was on has been taken off the market. nothing too do with me i hasten to add. so still looking for a home  x
Posts.Title: let down again

Posts.Content: this isnt really cancer related but just need to vent. due to stage 3 ILC diagnosis and several surgery's later with chemo next week and a mastectomy after i cant work. as a result i cant afford my current rental property so been looking for ages. then bingo, someone contacted me after i placed a wanted ad specifying my current health condition (i know its a bit desperate but i am desperate). i was very suspicious as i dont trust most people but spoke lots of times and it seemed genuine. she sent pics and everything seemed in order. found out today its all fake. it never was available! how could someone be so cruel. im devastated. so have 3 weeks until i have to move, as current property has now been sold, with nowhere to go. this cancer thing really does make you realise youre on your own in this life
Posts.Title: let down again

Posts.Content: ah thanks but ive already spoken to them and theres nothing out there for me. council have offered me a place in a homeless shelter but really dont want to go down that route whilst having chemo as not the cleanest of places. just feel disgusted with people
Posts.Title: let down again

Posts.Content: you are a star helen but unfortunately ive seen all these. just seems to be the same ones circulating on all sites. will keep looking though and thank you so much for helping, really appreciate it  x
Posts.Title: let down again

Posts.Content: hey may have found a property through a friend. fingers crossed.  x
Posts.Title: let down again

Posts.Content: thanks but have tried shelter and cab and every other possible agency /charity. just go round in circles and constant passing of the buck. its a complicated situation for me because they are saying i made myself intentionally homeless as i gave my notice to leave before i was diagnosed and house was put on the market and has been sold. i havent got the energy to pursue the evil person in question. but lets hope karma does its job! anyway im looking for 2 bed in exeter, devon just in case someone may know of anything. feel better now ive let off steam. onward and upward
Posts.Title: let down again

Posts.Content: there are a few but they wont take housing benefit. this is the problem  im registered with rightmove  and zoopla and all the local letting agents and have ads out everywhere. been looking for a couple of months now. thanks anyway  x
Posts.Title: let down again

Posts.Content: i too had the same experience. found a lump and  had to wait a week to see my gp,who ruled out breast cancer and thought it was a waste of time being referred for further investigation. however i firmly insisted and gp begrudging referred me. got to see the consultant at the hospital who also tried to fob me off and send me home without any tests. once again i insisted. am due for a mastectomy early next month due to lobular breast cancer! please please be firm and insist on tests. hope all goes well  x
Posts.Title: Don't know what to do
